title: Die Sabbathi, 13 Januarii, 1648. Whereas by an ordinance of Parliament, bearing date the 20th of December last, the Lord Mayor hath issued out his precepts for the due observation thereof, and that for the most part Common-councell-men are chosen in every ward, ...
author: England and Wales. Parliament.
notes: Common Council men have been elected in conformity with the Order of 20 December, No. 2811, q.v. They shall have power to act. Quest-men, constables, etc. are to be chosen under the ordinance of 18 Dec. Ordered: that these words (yee shall be true to our Soveraign Lord the King, that now is, and to his heirs and successors, Kings of England) be omitted from the Common Council men's oath, etc. -- Cf. Steele.
Signed: Hen. Scobell Cler. Parl. Dom. Com.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
